Package networkHandler

Class BetweennessCentralityMeasure

  • java.lang.Object
    • networkHandler.BetweennessCentralityMeasure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, GraphProperty<java.lang.Double>
    public class BetweennessCentralityMeasure
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphProperty<java.lang.Double>

    This class is responsible for calculating the Betweenness Centrality Measure of a Node in a Graph with help of a provided ShortestPathList.

    The calculation is performed by calling run(), which is inherited from the Runnable interface, therefore the class is suitable to be run as a separate Thread.

    In case of a given nodeId not existing in the given Graph, the calling of the printToConsole() method will result in returning an error message informing about the wrong input, since calculation will be aborted.

    Author:
    Fabian Grun
    See Also:
    GraphProperty

        graph - The Graph on which the calculation is done
        shortestPathList - An instance of ShortestPathList containing the information about the shortest Paths necessary for the calculations

      • run

        public void run()

        Method responsible for the actual calculation of the property value(s).

        The method first checks whether the given nodeId exists in the given Graph. If the nodeId is not present, calculation is aborted and isCalculationSuccessfull set to false.

        Specified by:
        run in interface GraphProperty<java.lang.Double>
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • printToConsole

        public void printToConsole()

        Method for printing the calculated result(s) as a message to the console.

        If the calculation was aborted, a message (marked as an error) explaining the reason is printed instead.

        Specified by:
        printToConsole in interface GraphProperty<java.lang.Double>
